result.execSummary:
The defendant Tareco Vashon Hodges was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 25% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.    DNA sample previously provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

Defendant Tareco Vashon Hodges in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Tareco Vashon Hodges in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght.
The Court has reviewed PSI as well as the letter from DOC regarding deft's correctional experience. The State is in compliance with Ch. 950 and indicates the victim has notice of today's date and expects to be here. Case recalled at 2:34 pm. Victim does not appear.
Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State agrees to follow PSI which calls for 3 yrs probation, conditions to include 6 mos RCJ. Defense is also asking the Court to follow the recommendation of the PSI.
